sen.j: 満快の曾孫である源為公が信濃国守として信濃に下り、伊那を名字とした子の伊那為扶が信濃源氏の祖となった。
sen.e: MINAMOTO no Tametomo, a great grandson of Mitsuyoshi, went down to Shinano as Shinano no kuni no kami (Governor of Shinano Province), and his son who made INA his family name, Tamesuke INA, was the progenitor of Shinano Genji.

sen.j: 為扶の孫幸扶は諏訪部幸扶と名乗り、その子孫が出雲国飯石郡の三刀屋郷の地頭職を得て出雲に入り、地名の三刀屋を名字としたことが三刀屋氏の始まりとされる。
sen.e: Sachisuke, a grandson of Tamesuke, bore the name of SUWABE, and his descendant was hired as Jitoshiki (manager and lord of manor) in Mitoya-go district in Iiishi-gun County of Izumo Province and moved to Izumo, and took the placename Mitoya as his family name which was considered the beginning of Mitoya clan.
sen.cmt: 「幸扶」の読みが不明です。Sachisukeとしました。

sen.j: 承久の乱で幕府側として活躍した諏訪部助長は承久3年（1221年）に三刀屋郷の地頭職を与えられ下向した。
sen.e: Sukenaga SUWABE who worked hard in the Jokyu War was hired as Jitoshiki in Mitoya-go district and went down to there in 1221.

sen.j: 鎌倉時代中期になると北条氏の権力が増大し、多くの鎌倉御家人が所領のある地方へと下向した時期である。

sen.e: Most of the clans which did splendid works later as daimyo (Japanese territorial lord) in the Sengoku period (period of Warring States) and warlords went down to the provinces in this period (for example, Mori clan and Yoshikawa clan).

sen.j: 三刀屋氏もこの例に漏れず、出雲国三刀屋郷を本拠とし、来たるべき戦国時代に備えたのである。
sen.e: Mitoya clan, which was no exception to this trend, prepared for the forthcoming period of Warring States headquartered in Mitoya-go district in Izumo Province.

sen.e: In 1335 after the Kenmu Restoration, when Takauji ASHIKAGA raised, in Kamakura, his standard of establishment of samurai government, Tadayoshi ASHIKAGA urged Sukeshige MITOYA, the head of Mitoya clan, to send an army.

sen.j: 出雲国守護の塩冶高貞も足利尊氏に味方、扶重も尊氏方に属し、延元2年/建武4年（1337年）には北陸方面で戦い、金ヶ崎城攻略戦や美濃国での北畠顕家への押さえに当たった。
sen.e: As Takasada ENYA, Izumo-no-kuni shugo (military governor of Izumo Province), took the side of Takauji ASHIKAGA, Sukeshige also belonged to the Takauji's side and fought in Hokuriku (north central region) where he participated in the battle of reducing Kanagasaki-jo Castle as well as suppression of Akiie KITABATAKE in Mino Province in 1337.

sen.j: その後、塩冶高貞は謀反により討伐されると、三刀屋氏は勢力を伸ばしてきた山名氏の傘下に入った。

sen.e: In the Meitoku War started by Mitsuyuki YAMANA in 1391, Mitoya clan seceded from Yamana clan's affiliation and participated in a punitive force against Yamana clan under the command of bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun).

sen.j: 天正元年（1573年）には天台座主補任問題にも関わり、正親町天皇より毛氈鞍覆弓袋などの使用許可を受けている。
sen.e: In 1573, he was involved in appointing Tendai-zasu (head priest of the Tendai sect) and granted the rights of using mosen kura-ooi (felt saddle-blanket), yumibukuro (bag for keeping a bow) and the like by the Emperor Ogimachi.

sen.j: 織田信長の死後に権力を掌握した豊臣秀吉に毛利氏が従属すると、久扶も秀吉の天下統一事業に狩り出され、九州各地を転戦している。

sen.j: 天正14年（1586年）に毛利輝元、吉川広家、小早川隆景の上洛に従い、その際に徳川家康に面会したことが毛利輝元の疑心を生み、三刀屋久扶は出雲の地を追放される。
sen.e: Hisasuke met Ieyasu TOKUGAWA in 1586 when he attended Terumoto MORI, Hiroie KIKKAWA, and Takaie KOBAYAKAWA as they went up to Kyoto, which made Terumoto MORI suspicious about Hisasuke, and as a result, Hisasuke MITOYA was expelled from the land of Izumo.

sen.e: Takasuke came short of recovering his fief Mitoya, and he left Mori clan and served Hosokawa clan, and in the Battle of Sekigahara in 1600, he joined the army locking itself up in Tanabe-jo Castle in Tango Province and did splendid service.
